The band loops and curls up the finger, the vines are set with leaves and dots. A plain ringshank is on the bottom, easily sizable up or down. 

The ring measures appx 5/8" wide on the very top, tapering quickly to a comfortably narrow shank.

description:
Our narrowest, daintiest melted wedding set- utterly unembellished. These bands are appx 2-3mm wide all around, concave, with undulating, natural lines.

They are completely comfy to wear- the convex interior slips on the finger and never cuts or digs. 

The set does *not* fit together and was not designed to, they simply harmonize and complement each other. This is not a set that can be easily soldered together, either, sorry.

*Shown in size 6, there's a slight softened spot on the bottom of each band where we can size these up or down for you. Half and quarter sizes welcome, simply state your size needs in the purchase comments. Please allow a few days for sizing. If your size is larger than an 8 or smaller than a 4.5, I'd prefer to cast you a new set, so please allow an extra couple of weeks.*
name: Narrow Melted Wedding Set

description:

This rose sits on the engagement ring part of the the set. Surrounding it- on both bands- are offshoots of leaves, curls, tendrils, and rosebuds... all formed and working their way around the big rose.

Several other smaller diamonds are set into this ring as accent stones. All repurposed diamonds, they range in color from G-I and grade from SI2 to VS1. Total diamond weight 0.47ct.

The bands are appx 1.9mm each, rounded for both strength and comfort. This set is meant to be worn together and can be soldered before shipment if desired. The design reaches across the finger nearly an inch in length.

description:
Andalusite is a fascinating stone- dichroic, which means it can have 2 colors inside of it and show each well- doubly refractive- which means extra sparkle.. and its a very rare gemstone. The rich green/red color play in the stone make it unique.

This ring holds a 5 x 4 oval andalusite, tucked into our popular Rook Nest style, this time in yellow gold. The rook nest design is made of bits of round stock, fused in the wax can cast as a whole unit for greater strength. Dots, beadwork, and twists embellish the design. There's a tiny round diamond accent in there as well, 0.03ct.

The ring covers about 15mm on the hand (appx 3/4") and tapers quickly on the back for more comfort, ending in a simple, comfortable shank that measures appx 3mm wide.

Utterly one of a kind piece.
name: Andalusite Rook Nest Ring

description:
Dainty little silver earrings, comprised of swirls of metal interspersed with roses. The design is handcarved for a perfect mirror image, measures about 9mm (appx 3/8") in length (not counting the leverback attachment), and is lightweight enough for comfortable wear everyday.

The bottom rosebud on the earring design is offset by a single leaf to one side, and a curl to the other side. This curl travels up and holds a tiny anemone blossom and another rosebud.

The topmost flower in each earring has been hand-set with a delicate, glittering blue zircon. Zircon is a natural stone, not to be confused with cubic zirconia. These particular stone measure just over 2mm each, and are tucked into the petals securely.

Simplistic sterling silver leverback attachments allow for easy and secure wearing of these heirloom earrings, and bring the total length to appx 5/8". Available as a stud earring [right here](http://wexfordjewelers.com/items/1136-Rose-Garden-Earrings?variation_id=1301)
name: Rose Garden Earrings, Dangle

description:
Who needs a bandage when you can kick it with this ring?

One rough, raw, uncut brown diamond crystal rests in this ring, offset slightly. The top of the ring is melted, torn, beaded, and rough. This part measures appx 10mm wide, 17mm long, and wraps around the topmost part of the finger at a gentle curve.

The band itself is narrower- easy to size and very comfortable. It measures 3mm wide, and is domed, attached to the ring with decorative cuffs. Currently a size 7, sizable up or down as needed.

The diamond is a mahogany brown in color, with flecks of gold on the top. It measures 2.2mm, weighs appx 1/10th ct, and has not had any cutting, polishing, or drilling.

The ring is sterling silver, finished in a matte black, with the raised bits polished to a bright silver finish. As the ring wears, the black will gently fade away from the higher spots, revealing more silver. Utterly one of a kind.

description:
Delicate green sapphire- natural color, set in the center of this lovely little leaf. We've molded an antique wedding set and then added our own earthy touches to create this wedding set. Cast in pink gold, and set with five champagne diamonds as accent stones, this set is a celebration of all of the colors of emerging Spring.

The central stone measures 5 x 3.5mm. It is a Thai green sapphire, showing a body color of mossy green, with undertones of yellow, brown, and gray. It is held in by five prongs that rise from the detail in the leaf. Set into both the engagement ring and the fitted wedding band are five brown diamonds- ranging in shade from a delicate woody champagne to a rich chocolate brown. The pink gold- warm coppery tones- blend the contrasting colors together in perfect symphony.

The leaf fits over the wedding band in one small area, allowing the set to 'clip' together when on the hand. Shown in a size 6, able to be sized- at no addt'l cost- up or down as needed- as small as 4 or as large as a 9. Need the set soldered together? Let us know before we ship it out, and we'll add that service for no charge! Or mail it back anytime for a solder.

The engagement ring  holds the largest rose, thick curls of metal, a tiny rosebud and an offset leaf. A heavy, curving band curls away from the top, beaded and twisting. The wedding band curls up and around the shape, with a leaf and another open rose. Beads and curling tendrils of metal accent both pieces.

This is a wedding set built for silver, built for long-term wear. It is thick, heavy, wide and bold. Although the ring is tallish, there are no protruding parts- the design rises up from the finger in an even dome.

Currently a size 6.5, can be size up or down. Please select your size from the dropdown box when ordering.

description:
Rough spinel crystals- nearly perfect in their crystal formation- have been set in this ring. The crystals came right out of the ground this way- no cutting, polishing, dyeing or drilling has happened to these.

The crystals measure: center is 3 x 3mm, side stones are 2.5 x 2.5mm. They are a vivid red- almost the color of a pomegranate seed. The red is complemented by the rich 18k yellow gold. The spinels are set in thin, handformed settings with several tiny prongs each. These are accented and strengthened by beads of gold fused into the 90 angles where the settings meet.

The band is cornered on the bottom, contoured slightly to thicken at the corners, and comes up and around the finger to corner again where it connects with the stone settings. The band measures appx 1.6mm wide at it narrowest, widening to just over 2mm.

Incredibly comfortable to wear, this ring just slips right on stays upright due to the cornered shape.

This ring was inspired by ancient Greek and Roman jewelry that I viewed at the Met nearly a decade ago. Funny how such a timeless design can float around in an artist's head for so many years and never quite die until it becomes executed. Above all else, beauty lives on...
name: Ancient

description:
Inspired by a photo of the oldest tree- an ancient bristlecone pine. This pendant was carved in the wax- formed by twisting wax threads together and delicately fusing them. Diamonds were slipped into the design here and there- glinting out of the darkened metal.

The tree is set against an oval frame for durability and visual focus. The tree is fused to the frame in spots, but hangs out and over it, and defies capture in other contact points- standing free.

A matching gnarled bail is fused to the top of the frame, large enough to hang from a decent weight chain or small omega. Currently hung from a thick, durable anchor link chain, it can be switched out for various ones if need be.

The entire thing measures 2.5" long, and 1.25" wide. Total diamond weight 0.27ct. Diamonds are repurposed from old jewelry- our answer to the conflict free sourcing issue. Utterly one of a kind.

SJC
name: The Oldest Tree

description:
Rough-torn chunks of silver comprise this ring... crude, but symmetrical. The band is appx 8mm wide at its widest point, narrowing at other spots.

Set in the middle of each plank are square sapphires- soft lovely green in shade. These are held in by hand-formed half bezels, almost a thin channel. The stones are set low to the finger, protected by the build of the ring. Between these planks are open zigzaggy slits, however, they are firmly welded pre-casting, so there should never be a strength issue unless the wearer is an absolute beast.

The ring shown is a size 12, and any other size would need to be custom ordered. Please see below for custom options.

(4) 2.5mm green sapphire princess cuts set in band

description:
Fog rolls up the hillside, trees outside rattle in the wind, and something unnamable clutches at your shoulder as you pass by. You know what's in there, you just don't know  if you want to face it again.

The stone is a dendritic quartz- a gem that has naturally formed tree-like fissures inside, which are then overtaken by darker mineral deposits to show up the wonderful patterns. No two stones are ever alike.

This particular specimen is a cloudy grayish shade, with blooms of the dendrite running at odd angles to itself inside. The stone measures 29 x 18mm, a rather modified cushion cabochon shape, and is held into the ring by clutching prongs. 

The ring was built specifically around the stone- twisting angry spokes of silver with the occasional diamond hidden inside. There are four diamonds tucked into the design, with a total weight of 0.10ct. They are repurposed diamonds, round cut, slightly champagne in color.

The sterling has been blackened with a chemical process, and the black will slowly wear off the high points with daily use. This can be reapplied at a jeweler's, or you can enjoy the natural antiquing emerging from the depths.

Measuring a 9.5 right now, it can be adjusted a bit up or down, but the sizing process would leave a bit of a smooth spot on the very bottom of the band. This ring lays flat against the finger, very comfortably, and would make a most excellent forefinger or middle finger ring. Utterly one of a kind. SJC.
name: Haunted

variations.backorder_notes: Please allow 3 - 6 weeks for this order to be created.

description:
A perfect spessartite garnet crystal, measuring appx 10mm across, sits wrapped in four prongs. The crystal is a flaming orange color, visibly included, yet nearly glowing from within with natural vivid color. It is a dodecahedron, measuring 10mm all the way around, and weighs 8.3cts.

The flared lily part of the ring attaches to the setting, wraps around the finger as it narrows to 7mm, and softens into a normal ringshank, for easy sizing. 

To the other side of the garnet is a row of 3 sapphires- natural stones, hued from orange to red. The stones are round, measure 2.5mm each, and are channel set low to the finger. 

Ring is 20mm wide at its very widest point, but tapers quickly.

SJC
name: Africa Fire Ring

variations.backorder_notes: Please allow 3 - 6 weeks for this order to be created.

description:
Rough citrine, set in a melted, pierced, torn and utterly freeform ring. The stone is a pale, soft, sunny yellow, with some visible color zoning visible inside. Prongs rise up out of the design to clutch the stone at various corners and edges. The stone measures appxly 8 x 10mm.

A single 0.07ct round diamond- repurposed from older jewelry- sits beside the citrine, prong set.

The ring is 7mm on the very bottom, widening to appx 19mm on top, or just about 3/4" wide. The ring stands up off the hand by about half an inch.

description:
A long, slender rough aquamarine piece is built into the skyscraper design of this ring. The stone measures appx 14 x 7mm, with one very rough edge on the angle there. The top of the stone shows natural crystal formation, and the stone is a lovely ocean blue color, with some darker spots of color zoning.

The stone is set low to the finger in a sort of structured box. We've built prongs coming up and out of the box to grip the stone, running the lines of the prongs along natural crystal edges. The prongs are thick and sturdy, and the ring should last quite a while as an everyday wearing piece.

Squared shoulders are satin brushed, providing a contrasting texture to the high polish on the rest of the ring.

The band is appx 5-6mm wide, and is currently a size 7, but can be sized up or down by a size if need be, just give us a day or two to do the work! It's a very comfortable band, and the little bit of space up under the stone setting area fits comfortably onto the hand.

One of a kind. Genuine stone, sterling silver. Ring spans 18mm (3/4") at the widest point on top.

Held in place by a thick bezel that is just as chunky as the stone itself, this gem will be protected for many years of wear.

To one side of the stone is a row of five round diamonds- 0.04ct each, for a total weight of 0.20ct They are set into thick, low prongs that bead up and repeat down the side of the ring band. The beadwork is bright polished, while the silver below is sandblasted. The band is 16mm wide on top, and tapers to 9mm on the bottom. 

The shank has a slight rolled edge as it comes up around the other side of the ring, and is somewhat squared in shape for a natural ergonomic fit on the hand. Size 6.

description:

The setting twists and eddies around the stone, with angular prongs jutting up out of the design to clutch edges. The stone itself measures appxly 12 x 10mm, and the setting is about 16mm long across the longest part. Beside the amethyst is a round champagne diamond, lovely color of gray-brown. It is 0.10ct, bezel-set, and stands up off the hand about 4mm.

description:

Dimensionally perfect- with raised areas for high polish and recessed areas that hold an icy matte finish. Although exclusive to Wexford Jewelers, this is a stock piece and can be ordered in gold or other gemstones.

description:
Delicately swirling tendrils of gold offset a large, open rose. A faceted yellow sapphire is nestled in the opening petals. The rose is central in the design, offset by two leaves near the flourishes of metal. Two tiny, perfect butterflies perch on the design, while the top of the swirls join together to hold a free-hanging pendant bail.

The bail is also organic in nature, large enough to hold a decent sized chain. It is currently hung from a 17" snake chain.

The sapphire- 3mm around- is natural yellow, no heat treating or synthetic processes. 

The entire pendant flows gently, curling around the rose. The pendant is 34mm in length, appx 1 1/4".

description:
Delicately swirling tendrils of gold offset a perfect rose. A yellow sapphire is folded tightly into the furling petals, sparkling out from the design. A single leaf offsets each rosebud, and a perfectly carved butterfly is perched on the edge of each earring.

The sapphires are natural yellow- no heat treating or synthetic processes. They measure 2.5mm each and were cast directly into the settings, so they are firmly in place forever.

The earrings are handcarved, forming a near-perfect mirror image of each other. They measure appx 16mm in length, roughly 5/8". They are assembled with sturdy post and nut findings, although this can be switched for clip-on, screwbacks, or Protektor backs if desired.

Perfect for daily wear, elegant for dressing up. Matching necklace available.

The band is 5mm wide, nice and solid, currently a size 6, sizable up or a down a little bit.

SJC

description:
Four butterflies wheel and flutter on this pretty ring. Three are visible on the top, perched on curling wind currents, and the fourth is tucked into the side of the ring.

The base ring is made of thick, curling bits of silver that connect underneath the butterfly accents. This is a ring that should last a good long time, as it is cast and solid, rather than assembled from soldered bits of silver.

Due to the open curlicues and the raised detail of the butterflies, we do recommend wearing this for everyday chores and whatnot. This is more of a dress-up piece.

It is long- 21mm from stem to stern. It covers nearly knuckle to knuckle.

The simple shank allows a wide range of sizes to be cut, simply select your size from the dropdown box below, please.

description:
A lifesize handformed aster blossom, just over half an inch across, holds a single diamond in this ring. The solitaire stone is a rich purply-brown blackberry sapphire. It measures 3mm, and weighs appx 1/6th of a carat, and is set so low into the center of the flower that it will never come out.

The detail of the band flows and loops around the entire finger. One of a kind piece, handcarved. Ring can also be blackened or antiqued if desired.

This is a one of a kind piece, the flower does not have a mold like some of our garden pieces. The band is a twisted vine of silver looping around the finger. The ring fits comfortably, but due to the rather spiky organic nature of the principal embellishment, we would not recommend wearing this for high-intensity activities such as gardening, laundry, and pumpkin carving.

description:
Love the root rings, but having a hard time finding the perfect size/fit/width? Here's a way to get all of that, without the confusion of starting a custom piece from scratch.

We'll carve up your ring from the guidelines laid out here- send you a photo of the wax model before it gets cast in silver- and you'll still have a one of a kind unique piece of wearable art.

First step: choosing your stone. This is a selection of medium-sized raw Nigerian green beryl (pale emerald). You can see the basic size by the mm lengths drawn out on the graph paper.

Second step: Choosing your basic design look. *Rebuilding* and *Sharp* will have the stone running with the finger, while *Constrained* and *Cradled* will set the stone horizontally on your hand, or against the finger, unless you choose the widest profile. The stone setting technique will be whatever suits the natural crystal structure of the stone best, generally a combination of hand-cut prongs and half-bezel.

Third step: Choosing your side accent. Here we have just 4 shown: diamonds of varying shape, sapphire rounds, and a strip of yellow gold accent welded into place. There are plenty more available- how about a birthstone, or a sliver of black onyx? Again- stone setting technique will be determined by shape and depth of stone chosen. If there is another ring on this website that strikes you as perfect for a side stone or a specific design element, please note that in your purchase comments for the artist.

Fourth step: Choosing a finger profile- how far do you want this to stretch across your hand? Keep it thin and dainty, or have the design range nearly from one knuckle to the next? Your own finger size may have some bearing on this- short fingers tend to not bend well with a very wide ring, etc.

All-inclusive price includes gemstone, silver setting, side accent, all labor. If more elements are added (such as further customization or additional stones), customer will be informed of additional charges before work is done, and the charges will be the balance on the finished piece, due before shipping.

Questions about this process? Ideas? [Email Sarah](mailto:sarah@wexfordjewelers.com).
name: Custom Root Ring: Raw Beryl

description:
Swirling eddies of water ripple around this ring, and on the very top they lap around a single round diamond. The diamond is repurposed and weighs 0.09ct. It is SI2 clarity, H color, and a very pretty stone. It is held firmly in place by a bezel surrounding 85% of the circumference of the stone.

The design, like so many of ours, is completely hand formed in the wax. There is a rippling, criss-crossing texture in the recessed areas of the design, and a bright polish on the higher spots. The band is appx 3/8" wide at its widest point, and narrows to about 5mm.

Only sizable between a 6.5 and an 8.5 due to the squarish design.

SJC

description:
Rough garnet- purchased directly from the Zambian mine owner- is set into this swirling freeform band. The ring wraps around the finger, rigidly underneath the finger, then more and more organic as it gets to the surface, with piercings, and melted spots, then the setting rising up from the ring to clutch the stone.

The garnet measures roughly 6X10mm, and shows crystal structure as well as natural cleavage planing. It is a gorgeous blood-red stone with a hint of brown and orange.

SJC
name: Scarlet Ice

description:
Tall and bold, this ring holds a single repurposed diamond. Round diamond, weighing 0.28ct, SI2, I color, firmly tucked into the silver setting. The ring has a low profile and is extremely comfortable due to the squarish cornered shape.

The band wraps around the finger, with the tapering end melted onto the wider end. This is where the diamond is held in place, and the tree trunk texture begins just below the diamond setting. There are a few  open pierced areas, and the ring is primarily sandblasted and etched, then polished in the accent areas.

Sizing is an option (currently 6.5), it will not be a traditional sizing, but a raised, demarked area on the bottom corner where the wire will solder in. It will look like part of the design, though, so no worries. Alternatively, we can remake a ring like this in your size or gemstone!

SJC

description:
Raw aquamarine- uncut, unpolished, untouched by human hand other than this setting.

This stone measures 15mm at longest, and 6mm at widest. Set into a squarish wide band, accented with diamonds. The band wraps around the finger, thinner at the bottom and widening towards the top. The entire length is nearly an inch on top.

The setting juts up and out of the ring to grip the stone, with open spaces here and there that enable the stone to be seen from different angles. A lot of planning went into this ring- sometimes our pieces take on a small-scale architectural level! 

Beside the stone, along the smooth side of the ring, there are two baguette diamonds- repurposed stones from other jewelry. Together, they weigh just under 1/10th of a carat. The band is etched with divergent lines on one side- lines that flow from the stone down into the body of the ring... and the other side is smooth and cool.
name: Collision Aqua

description:
The Aral Sea is drying, leaving tiny patches of lake behind. This stone reminds me of aerial photos of the area.

This is a slab of Chinese turquoise- measuring appx 28 by 24mm. It is set into a simple hand wrought ring- a 4mm bevel around the stone supports double prongs at intervals, and the bevel is finished in a rough, sparkling stone texture, while the prongs are polished for contrast. A second, hidden rim of silver beneath the stone supports the entire design and ties in with the ring shank.

Because of the architectural styling, this will be a sturdy ring for many years to come.

The band is a simplistic, thick ring that measures 6.5mm. It is slightly beveled inside for comfort.
name: Aral Sea Turquoise Ring

description:
Gently swirling rose petals wrap around the finger to hold a single, perfect rose bloom. Set in the center of this rose is a 4mm natural pink sapphire, faceted. The stone is a delicate shade of pink, there is a slight inclusion visible inside along one edge, naturally occurring in stones like this often.

Two leaves offset the rose, solidly formed into the rest of the ring. The bypass style of this band fits gracefully onto a ring finger and will be very comfortable for years to come. This ring would make an excellent engagement or promise ring.

While this exact layout is one of a kind, this ring can be remade in a similar style, or with contrasting colors of gold, and with different center stones.

description:
Pick up that piece of paper, wrinkled on the ground. There might just be treasure inside, you won't know until you study it.

This crumpled, melted, and nearly destroyed circle of silver measures 34mm around. Placed atop a simple squared band, it will clear your hand and fit quite comfortably. The square corners are to stabilize the ring, and the openness of the corners keep it lightweight, yet structurally strong.

A single cultured pearl is set on a hidden post on the ring, it measures 5mm in diameter.

Handformed in wax, lost wax cast, strong and durable. Currently size 7 1/4, sizable up or down by about a size.

Utterly one of a kind ring.

SJC
name: Discarded

description:
Ripped and torn silver wraps around the finger at angles to itself. Sandblasted, melted, fused and bleeding, this ring carries on, and manages to hold three diamonds tightly in an open channel. The 'shredded' design was made by chilling the wax, then splitting it carefully before forming the ring shape.

The diamonds are repurposed from meltdown jewelry, set low to the finger. They weigh 0.12ct total, and are mid-grade, but the price of the ring reflects that.

The itself is squarish in shape, very comfortable on the hand, since our natural finger shape tends to be that way in a closed hand. Due to the design and shape, this ring is not able to be sized much up or down. If you do not see your desired size in the dropdown box, we'd be happy to re-create a unique band for you in this style!
name: Dune Mask, Coldformed

The sapphire is 3mm in diameter, with flashes of red and orange in its depths. It is tucked so low into the rose that it would be nigh impossible to knock it out, so it is a great wearing ring for those of you who are active!

The rose is accented by two tiny round diamonds- repurposed from some meltdown jewelry. The diamonds measure 1.5mm each, and weigh appx 0.04ct tdw.

The ring is cast in sterling silver, and would make an adorable stacking wedding set if accented- sometime in the future- with a couple of thin alternating color metal bands- such as pink gold!

description:
"Ickle Ockle, blue bockle,

 Fishes of the sea, 

 If you want a pretty maid,  

 Please choose me!"

         ~Mother Goose Ryhmes


Mermaid ring, handcarved. Her flowing hair wends out from her lithe body, connecting to the crashing waves that make up the ringshank.

Appx 1 3/4" total length across the finger, this ring stretches nearly from knuckle to knuckle. Set with repurposed champagne single cut diamonds, weighing 0.21ct tdw.

Although I will carve a mermaid or faerie from time to time, there are no production molds yet on these pieces, each one is utterly unique. You can wear her knowing that you have the only one exactly like this in the world!

description:
The beacon pulsates light across the seas, guiding seafarers homeward.

A single white sapphire sits directly in the center, held in place by four symmetrical but organic prongs. Going down the band, the prongs begin to melt and bead up on the sandblasted surface. 

The band itself is cast in sterling silver, concave, and measures 6.5mm wide.

Set with a natural 3.0mm round white sapphire center stone, faceted and with a gentler sparkle than a diamond. Although this one of a kind piece is a size 7, and not sizable, you may order this ring in any size, nearly any center gem, and even in other metals! Please allow 6 weeks for production. Simply state your size preference in the purchase, or if you'd like a different gemstone/metal, please email for a price quote.
name: Lighthouse Beacon

description:
In the spring of 2010, we purchased a parcel of Montana sapphires directly from a dealer. There stones heading for the faceting tables- stones that are full of color and life inside. Instead of having them cut, we've been using them directly in the rings you've come to love- rough, raw, organic, untouched by human hand.

We built this low setting around this stone- there will never be another quite like it. Bars and rims of liquid silver form reverberating ripples away from the stone and down the ringshank. A single, long baguette hugs one side of the stone- a rare diamond in that the length is 5 times the width. Diamonds are very complicated to cut like this, and we thought it would be best to be protected by burying it close to the sapphire.

The prongs that hold the stone in come from every angle of the ring, softly clutching the earthy browns and siennas. There is a sandblasted surface over most of the ring, with some higher detail picked out with a bright polish. 

The hand finishing that goes into our rings is singularly exquisite- comfortable edges, attention to detail over every surface and angle, and a fit that you might fight for! This ring is squared to fit the natural contours of the hand- no rolling on the finger. Because of the design, the size range is somewhat limited, but we are always happy to make a custom piece!

Sterling silver, the center stone measures 12 x 7mm, weighs 4.55ct, a rough Montana (USA) tea-colored sapphire. Accent stone: 0.08ct repurposed diamond baguette.
name: Rebuilding Civilization II

variations.backorder_notes: Please allow 3 - 6 weeks for this order to be created.

description:

The stone is set low to the finger, wrapped in a half bezel of sterling silver and shored up on the other side by a thick prong that rises from the band.

The ring measures 18mm across the top,  and 7mm at the narrowest point on the bottom. Ring is currently a size 5.5

description:
Although we handcarve many of our lovely and unique items here, every now and then we find a vintage piece worth reproducing. We always get the owner's blessing on that, then pour a RTV silicon mold, thus ensuring the design can be passed down for generations.

This is one such wedding set. The single, elegant leaf, etched with stylized veining, the simplistic curve of the fitted band, and ringshanks delicate enough for even a thin hand, but sturdy enough for daily wear.

 The stone is set low and protected, the contoured prongs won't stick up and snag your clothes!
name: Sterling Silver Leaf Wedding Set

description:
Simplistic melted band, set with an Arizona peridot. The stone is oval, set against the finger, low into the setting. It measures 9 x 7mm, and has visible inclusions of both white and black inside.

The band undulates around the finger, comfortably conformed to a natural squarish fit. Cannot be sized, due to design, sorry. We would, however, be happy to make you one of your very own- we have a small parcel of stones like this! Each ring would be unique, as this is not a design that we carry a mold on, more of a technique of building (then melting!) the ring...

The entire band is appx 6-8mm wide, made of thick silver for years of durability.
 SJC

description:
This [eudialyte](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eudialyte) is a stone mined from Russia. This specimen is cut into a 24 x 14mm oval cabochon. It has a base body color of a rich maroon, with streaks of deep green, flecks of black, and small bits of white crystal. We set it into a thick, domed, satin brushed bezel.

Beneath the stone is an exquisitely shaped gallery piece. Instead of a plain stone base, we thought something as lyrical would fit this stone better. Every tiny detail on this ring was thought out, planned to come together to make the heirloom piece that you see here.

The band swoops up gracefully from the finger to meet the central bezel. Inside the triangle on each side is set a round 4mm rhodolite garnet. 

This ring is solid, handcarved, and carries some decent weight. The bottom of the shank is ever so slightly squared, for more comfort between the fingers, and to keep the ring upright on the hand as well. The inside shank is contoured for comfort. Although the ring is solid enough for daily wear, the stone itself is delicate, and requires some care when wearing. We do not recommend wearing this while doing anything rough and tumble.
name: Eudialyte & Garnet

variations.backorder_notes: Please allow 3 - 6 weeks for this order to be created.

description:
A long, rough, raw tourmaline is set into a notched bezel here, surrounded by an entire row of diamonds, and placed atop a uniquely ancient looking band.

The stone itself is a delicate shade of spring green, hued a bit deeper towards one end of the crystal. It is a completely untouched crystal- undrilled, unfaceted, unpolished. We based the entire design of the band on the broken symmetry of the natural crystal form. The stone measures 22 x 7mm, and the central crystal outgrowth is a rough nub that sticks up from the main spire about 3mm additional.

Surrounding the tourmaline are 38 tiny round full-cut diamonds, each weighing about 0.01ct, prong set on one side and tucked into the bezel on the other side. The diamond weigh a total of 0.42ct. Deep cut milgrain texture adorns the undulating lines of both the bezel and the band.

The bottom of the band is concave, but softly curved on the inside for a very comfortable fit. Slits in the metal beneath the stone let light through for better glow, and act as cleanout vents for cleaning. The 6mm band is attached to the stone design with solid shoulders, and the ring measures 30mm in length (appx 1.25"). The entire ring is cast in 18k yellow gold.
name: Pillar, 18k

description:
Melted, fingerprinted, flowing and blackened, this ring wraps comfortably around the finger and ends in a jarring stillness, set with a single ruby marquise.

The ring measures 10mm at its widest point across the finger, tapering to 4mm on the bottom. The ruby- genuine, delicate pinkish red in color- measures 3 x 5mm and is set deeply and securely into the silver.

You can see my actual fingerprints in the metal, from warm hands forming the wax before casting. Torn edges look wicked, but are softened for comfort. The black finish is optional, and will gently wear with time. It can re-applied at any jeweler, or you can simply discover the patina of wear that will form from months of wear!

Size 5.5, not sizable due to design, sorry. Completely one of a kind piece, comfort fit inside shank will fit you like a... well, like a perfect ring!

SJC
name: Tertiary in Black and Red

description:
Crisp symmetry and sharp contrast mark this ring. Gleaming shoulders of silver hold a uniquely colored tourmaline, while two diamonds march silently up the side as an accent seen only in profile.

The 2.4 ct tourmaline starts at one end in an earthy pink tone, fading into clear, then a hint of green plays into the criss-cross scissor facets, and sharply trends into another shade of pink entirely. This color zoning is why we felt the stone had to be put into a very symmetrical, clean mounting.

Four of the prongs rise up from the band to clutch the long sides of the stone, while the ends are trapped in by heavy low prongs. A tiny diamond is set onto each straight side, further accenting the half-split symmetry of the ring.

The tourmaline measures 7 x 9mm, the diamonds weigh a total of 0.06ct, and the ring is one of a kind. The band is no wider than 4mm at its widest point (across the top)

The bypass style ring wraps thickly and comfortably around the finger and comes up catty-cornered to itself to hug the stone. description:
Root rings are our signature design pieces. With an organic ebb and flow to them, and a shape that fits a hand's natural contours, these rings look like something that came from the ground.

This is why we often use raw stones in this series- natural, uncut gemstones that came from the ground in their own form and have been set into the body of the design where they fit best. This particular stone is a 12x8mm river sapphire, softly blue/brown/gray, dredged from the Missouri River in Montana, USA. That pebbly look you see is simply from years of riverbed wear. This stone is completely natural- no heating, faceting, drilling, or irradiating.

The central sapphire is accented with a faceted princess cut teal sapphire. The ring is cast in recycled sterling silver, handmade in our Northern Michigan foundry. It measures 14.5mm at the widest part of the band 9mm at the narrowest part, and is shaped squarish to fit better. 

Currently fits an 8-8.5 comfortably. Sorry, but this ring cannot be sized due to the design of the band. We would be happy to make you a custom original in your own size, however!
name: River Eddy Blue

description:
...or, the legend has it, you might go blind.

This handformed sunshine pendant has been an ongoing project at Wexford Jewelers for about 2.5 years! It's finally complete- and perfect- and we're proud to share it now with you.

The pendant measures just over an inch around, with eight wavy rays surrounding a central golden pearl. Each sunray is set with four yellow sapphires- graduating in size from 1.8 to 2.4mm, also graduating in color from a tangy lemon yellow towards the center of the pendant, to a rich brilliant yellow towards the tip. Over 1 carat of sapphires.

The pearl is a genuine South Seas pearl- natural in color and finish. It glows with a quite heavenly luster- possibly the subconscious inspiration for this design! It measures 7mm exactly, and is set firmly on a white gold post.

The entire pendant is cast in white gold, with a free-hanging bail, also studded with sapphires. Comes complete on a decent weight pendant chain, see dropdown box for length choices.
name: Don't Gaze too Long into the Sun

description:
Dry riverbeds crisscross and flow around this band. The design is cast in 14k white gold, set with six repurposed diamonds- one marquise (sideways) and five round single cuts.

The one of a kind band measures 12mm wide at the widest top point, and tapers in a meandering sort of way down to 6mm. The marquise is almost dead center on top, set against the finger, low into the gold. The diamonds are set between riverbeds in two sets of two and three, respectively.

The design pattern runs the entire band, meaning that this ring cannot be sized (sorry!), however, it can be reordered in your width, gemstone preference, and metal color if desired. Of course, you'd be ordering the technique, not the exact ring. Your very one unique piece of art to wear, forever...

Currently it fits a 7-7.5 very comfortably. The open spaces between the design elements allow for easy cleaning, breathability, and visual interest. The entire ring is somewhat beveled on the inside, making for a very comfortable fit.

Artist initialled inside, as well as dated (2010).
name: Riverbeds, Diamond Version I

description:
Gem silica Chrysocolla is actually a variety of fine Chalcedony. The color- an intense cyan with banding in cerulean and teal- deepens over time as one wears the stone. There is a bit of translucency to the gem- just enough to catch and hold light. It is one of our very favorite stones, and extremely difficult to come by the intense, solid color in this ring.

While 'regular' chrysocolla is a Mohs hardness of appx 4, the chalcedony version is a 7.5 and very durable. This piece has been bezel set low to the finger for even more lengthy wear.

The melted, torn and sandblasted design is one of a kind, although one of our signature techniques. The stone itself measures 15mm x 7mm, and the band is 22mm (7/8") at its widest point, tapering down to a comfortable 7mm on the bottom and one side.

This ring is only sizable by 1 size down and up to 2 sizes up. It currently fits an 8 (give or take a 1/4 size, as these rings go) very comfortably. Equally elegant for a man or a woman.

The design is sandblasted in the low regions and high polished on the edges and the bezel top. Artist initialled inside. Sterling silver.
name: Gem Silica Chrysocolla Ring- Melted, Torn

description:

The stone measures appx 10 x 8mm, roughly rectangular in shape, and stands up off the finger by about 6mm. There is a single champagne diamond accent next to the stone.

The central rose measures appx 10mm in dimension, and the entire length on the finger is about 18mm. The band is a nicked and pitted cathedral band, tapering down to 3mm on the bottom, and comfort fit inside.

description:
Our popular custom Melted band, available to order with a single central gemstone. The band measures appx 6-7mm all around. It is a handformed piece, every time we make it. No molding process works on this, so we keep it as a unique, made-to-order basis item.

When you order, you can specify the finger size and gemstone, up to a certain point. If this width is too much, it can be made as narrow as 3.5mm. Any wider will have to be ordered separately, as it entails a different finishing method. Gemstones currently available in this ring: 

sapphire

emerald

ruby

tourmaline (green or pink)

aquamarine

tiger eye

citrine

amethyst

garnet (green, red, orange or purple)

iolite

jade

... and too many more to list! State your desired gemstone, shape of gem, finger size, and finish (blackened silver or plain white) in the purchase comments when ordering this ring, and it will be completed within 6 weeks of ordering. Available in faceted or cabochon stones.

For quotes on a diamond or high-grade center stone, please email us.
name: Melted Band, Solitaire Gemstone

It weighs exactly one tenth of a carat, and is set so low into the center of the flower that it will never come out.

This is a one of a kind piece, the flower does not have a mold like some of our garden pieces. The band is a twisted vine of silver looping around the finger. The ring fits comfortably, but due to the rather spiky organic nature of the principal embellishment, we would not recommend wearing this for high-intensity activities such as gardening, laundry, and intricate central nervous system surgery. Does anyone read this far down?

SJC

description:
Inspired by the replicating circles of Alphonse Mucha, and a peculiar affinity for the color green, this ring was born! 

A soft sage green cat's eye chrysoberyl is bezel set into the center of this ring. Cat's eye chrysoberyl, for those of you unfamiliar with the stone, is a highly prized gem with a naturally occurring shimmer down the center. This is caused by fiber strands of the mineral aligning themselves in a way that catches the light. 

We surrounded this 6 x 8mm oval gemstone with sixteen small round diamonds, bar set in radiating lines from the center. Radiating further from the center, the lines widen a little bit and hold sixteen sage green natural round sapphires, 3mm each. 

Total diamond weight 0.32ct. Total sapphire weight appx 3cts.
name: Russian Princess Ring w/ Cat's Eye Chrysoberyl

description:
Just barely green, this raw Nigerian beryl rests in a unique customized setting. Small flecks of iron oxide punctuate the stone's surface, while the stone itself seems to glow from within.

The center stone measures 11 x 7mm, weighs 2.5cts, and is a delicate pale green. The top and sides are rough crystal, while the ends have been slightly faceted to fit better into the setting. 18k Yellow gold wraps around the stone, forming a solid bezel on top, yet it is pierced through in places on the sides for better light transmission and cleanout.

The emerald is flanked by two rows of three diamonds each, baguettes measuring appx 3mm long. Total diamond weight is 0.24ct. The gold channels holding the diamonds are marked with delicate milgrain texture.

The band is squared to the fit the finger's natural shape, and rolled at the bottom angles, forming two distinct rods. These are a design element that remind us of jewelry found in ancient Etruscan and Roman digs, thus the name.

The ring is finished with a combination of satin brush finish and bright polish. It is weighty and solid, fits beautifully, and is completely one of a kind.
name: Artifact, Green

variations.backorder_notes: Please allow 3 - 6 weeks for this order to be created.

description:
A valuable rich blue indicolite is nestled into this twisted setting. Vines and branches curl up and around the gemstone, as well as working their way around the finger to create the ringshank.

The indicolite is from old stock- untreated, unheated, and cut right at the mine. You can clearly see the slight inclusions and imperfections in both the clarity and the cut, which is why we put it in such an organic setting. We feel this piece is something of a collector's piece, but you be the judge.

There is detail all around this ring, yet it still lies comfortably against the hand. A tiny diamond accent is tucked into the body of the design, and open spaces allow the finger to be seen through the ring. The tourmaline measures 5.5mm and weighs just shy of a carat, while the diamond is about 2mm (0.03ct).

**The ring is currently a size 6. It can be sized up or down, but it would leave a slightly smooth area with little detail, somewhere on the bottom. If this is acceptable, please choose your size from the dropdown box**
name: Abandoned Garden Indicolite

description:
Vivid magenta sapphire, raw and uncut, pulled from the alluvial deposits in Madagascar. The focal point is the center stone, measuring appx 12 x 7mm. Surface scarring and crystal structure very visible on top of the ring. In a concave area of the stone, we've set another shard of sapphire, appx 5mm long.

Swirls and lapping tidal waves of molten silver clutch the stones in place and ripple down one side of the band, ending in a bar of channel set square faceted rubies. These fit naturally into the 'corner' between the fingers, treasure stones that only show when your hand is open. These rubies are natural color, measuring 2.5mm each, channel set right into the body of the design.

The band itself measures between 14mm and 7mm wide, depending on where you measure it. Cast in reclaimed sterling silver. Utterly one of a kind piece. Comfortably fits a size 6.5-7. Not sizable due to the design, sorry.

Artist signed and dated. SJC
name: Ebb, Flow and Surge

description:
A raw gray diamond crystal rests in this bezel ring, accented by two faceted diamonds. A rim of white gold traverses the edge of the bezel, exaggerating the points and sitting flat against the finger.

Celebrating the natural shape of the diamond crystal, we've made the setting melted, undulating, and natural, but still symmetrical. The entire ring is hand formed, 14k white gold, and uniquely built for the stone that it holds.

The diamond weighs 0.34ct, measures appx 4mm across, and is set low into the setting. The band is appx 4-5mm, tapering out as it gets to the back of the finger, and it is slightly squared to the natural shape of the hand.

description:
Another underground ring, this one inspired by salvage metal. Square to the finger, it fits comfortably in the natural shape of your hand. 

Shards of silver wrap around the finger and around themselves, not one having a sharp exposed edge, though. The center stone is a 9 x 7mm cherry fire opal, rich red-orange in color and with some opalescence internally. The accent stones are both sapphires, one a round yellow measuring 3mm, the other a round fire sapphire that is 2mm. 

Cast in sterling silver and finished with a combination of brushing, sandblasting, and stone texturing, this ring is completely one of a kind- the stone, the setting, and the concept. Due to the design, it is only able to be sized up or down by one size, but the sizing and shipping would be free! 

SJC
name: Cherry Fire Opal Underground

description:
Sterling silver Drusy Pendant on a 16" double strand of green oblong pearls. The stone measures approximately 47 x 28mm (almost 2"x1.25") and has five 5x3mm emeralds set around the pendant mounting.

Drusy agate freeform cabochon, stone was force dyed green. The green picked out various shades within the banded agate, not reaching quite to the center of the stone. Thousands of tiny crystals, dispersed over the natural agate formations, sparkle in the center of the stone. 

Four thick prongs, hand carved, hold the stone in place and flow into the design. The five emeralds are also set into body of the design, showing only from the sides of the pendant, with curves of liquid silver flowing up and around the emeralds to hold them in place.

The pendant is fixed to the pearl strands, openwork on the back shows the stone. This is a very heavy, decadent piece, and a celebration of every shade of green.
SJC
name: Green.

description:
Root rings are our signature design pieces. With an organic ebb and flow to them, and a shape that fits a hand's natural contours, these rings look like something that came from the ground. 

This is why we often use raw stones in this series- natural, uncut gemstones that came from the ground in their own form and have been set into the body of the design where they fit best. This stone is an 10 x 7mm river sapphire dredged from the Missouri River in Montana, USA. The color is amazing- smokey grey-blue at one end, fading to a softer brownish blue towards the other end, with a bit of iron oxide trapped in the lighter end of the stone. 

That pebbly look you see is simply from years of riverbed wear. This stone is completely natural- no heating, faceting, drilling, or irradiating. There are cleavage planes throughout the stone, natural fractures within the crystal, but not detrimental to the strength of the piece. 

To one side of the stone are four tiny round sapphires (faceted) tucked into the body of the design. These measure 1.5mm and are a deep navy blue. 

This ring is one of a kind, it fits a size 6 to 6.5 comfortably because of the inside round contour. Sizing up or down by a size or two will be included in the price. Cast in reclaimed sterling silver. 

SJC
name: River Dredge

The cabochon cut carnelian agate measures 28 x 21mm, and is gypsy set with multiple prongs. Roses and vines curl up and around the setting, forming the bail. The pendant is hung from a 24" handcrafted link chain, everything is sterling silver.

It is polished to a high luster, and has just enough translucency to glow a bit in the sunlight! The setting was, like all of ours, handcrafted right here in our Northern Michigan foundry. description:
A single tulip holds a one carat rose-cut chocolate diamond. Delicate leaves wrap around the stone to hold it in place, and curling stems arc out and away from the bloom. A bit of bulb on the bottom holds a second diamond, also pear shaped, but traditionally faceted instead of rose cut. 


The main diamond is a lovely hazy brown color with some natural color zoning. Because it falls into the fancy color zone, there is no color rating, but the grade is SI2. It weighs 0.96ct, and is set securely in the prong and leaf design. 


The second diamond weighs 0.12ct and is very white and clean. This is also set deeply into the design, hidden when on the finger, but peeking out when the hand is moved just right. It is one of our treasure stones- there simply as an accent to be discovered, rather than a centerpoint of design.


The ring is hand cast in 18k yellow gold, we felt that the rich tone of the diamond needed an equally rich shade of metal. Design is completely one of a kind. Not sizable due to the design.
name: Lale

description:
At one time, precious and rare alexandrite was only found in Imperial Russia, and was saved for royalty. 

Today, it is still rare and precious, rivaling diamonds and fine rubies in price, but it has been found in Asia as well. 

In honor of the Russian history, we set set this stone in an antique-style setting. 18k yellow gold forms a delicate band, coming up to hold the stone in a small, low box. Six diamonds- two baguettes and four tiny rounds- accent the central stone. 

The alexandrite is a cushion cut measuring 5.5 x 5mm, weighing 1/2ct. It has a fine clarity and a nice teal blue shade, turning to brownish purple under various light. If you are unfamiliar with the fascinating color change and history of this stone, we highly recommend [this article](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexandrite#Alexandrite). 

Total diamond weight for this piece is 0.10ct. 18k yellow gold, one of a kind ring.
name: The Lost Czarina Alexandrite Ring

description:
A rather unconventional wedding set- rubies, roses and green gold leaves! The central rose holds a 4mm deep pink sapphire- too light to be considered a ruby, but a cousin nonetheless, since corundum is the base mineral for each stone.

This is offset by another rose, a curl of gold holding rubies, and two small leaves of green gold. A few more rubies scatter throughout the set. Due to the organic shapes of the bands, the set does not mate airtight all around, but it fits together very well, and the rounded bands fit very comfortably on the hand.

While this specific set is unique, we have a mold on the base design (made by Wexford Jewelers, exclusive to Wexford Jewelers) and can rebuild this set in different metals, with different stones, and in varying dimensions.

Total gem weight appx 0.80ct.
name: Ruby Rose Garden Wedding Set

description:
Welcome spring (or at least dream of it) with this ring. Boasting a tulip that stands up off the finger by 17mm (5/8"), it rests wrapped in leaves and embellished with gold plated accents.

The tulip is quite large, measuring 15mm wide at its widest point, while the band tapers from 4mm on the bottom to 7mm on the sides.

Perfectly detailed, there's a slight curvature to the petals and leaves, with some gentle veining to be seen. The center is detailed with dimensional pistil and stamen, also tinged gold for contrast. 

Completely one of a kind, this was hand carved late one night while watching BBC mysteries and wishing for winter to end. I've initialed the bottom (SJC).

Cast in reclaimed silver, measuring a size.
SJC
name: Spring Comes Yet Again

description:
A sterling silver structure formed around dendritic quartz, accented by sapphires. The entire design is formed in threes, with the sapphires set into nubbed bezels, arranged in two separate triads around the central stone.

The main stone is a dendritic quartz measuring appx 14 x 20mm. You can look into this stone for hours! Dendritic moss arms or black, white, and navy blue radiate throughout the creamy-clear matrix of the cabochon.

A second tier of design stands out from the stone, bringing the total width to 30mm (just over an inch), and the length to 40mm (about 1 5/8")

The custom bail is fixed to the pendant, double-tiered in design, with the top layer stone brushed for a texture variant. The pendant hangs from a gorgeous 2mm twisted wire with a slimline twist catch. Sterling silver, one of a kind piece.

SJC
name: A New Kind of Biohazard

description:
This was the wedding ring worn by my Bisnonna (great-grandmother) Silvia Mascarin. We pulled a mold off it to preserve the lovely design for posterity. 

Are we a little bit biased because we love to use it often? Maybe, but who cares? It's pretty enough to sway opinion.

Mathematically perfect sides forms Art Deco petals of a sort, holding the central stone in place, as well as being studded with a diamond each.
name: Bisnonna's Ring

description:
Curls and dots in simple symmetry make up this lovely band. If you have a craving for early 20th century detailing, this should cure it, although it's been carved and cast in the early 21st century- our own design inspired by the steampunk revolution. The detail reaches appx 3/4 around the finger, depending on your finger size. The detail is raised and hand carved, not stamped.

The band measures 16mm wide at the widest point on top, and has a sturdy shank measuring nearly 4mm across. Sizable to nearly any finger size, able to be customized with gemstones if need be. Available in a wide variety of metals and finishes, as well.
name: Victorian Band

description:
Your story is unique- your past and your future are like no other. So why wear a ring that looks like every one out there?

Blips and squares pattern this 7mm (appx 1/4" wide) handcarved band. Raised rails protect the interior detail, and a comfort fit band is sturdy and easy to wear.

Nearly all of our metal is post-consumer, and our artwork is completely unique...

description:
Train tracks start and stop abruptly on this ring, one side gripping a white sapphire in place. The band- melted silver that widens on top of the finger- is squarish in shape. 

The silver is rippled, dotted, sandblasted, polished, and pierced. The natural sapphire is cast directly into the setting, as corundum can handle the heat of molten sterling. The shape of the ring hugs the finger on the bottom, and stands out for notice on top. Unisex. 

Completely one of a kind, as are all of our Underground pieces. This ring cannot be sized due to the design, but we'd be happy to create you one of your own unique piece loosely based on this shape, in whatever size you could possibly need. 

The sapphire measures 3.5mm and weighs appx 0.28ct. The band measures 14mm at the widest point. 

SJC
name: Derailed

description:
Handformed roses, delicate and graceful, make a crown on your finger with this ring. Each rose holds an antique single-cut diamond trapped in the petals. Etruscan beadwork dots the band and blooms. 

The gentle cathedral style band rises up the roses and is hammered, filed, and completely textured. The tops of the petals are high polished, but the natural repouss casting grain has been left intact inside the centers of the roses. This ring is study in form and finish. 

Diamond weight totals 1/10th of a ct, or 0.10ct. This ring is hand cast in 18k yellow gold. 

SJC
name: Trieste Roses

description:
A single rough cognac diamond crystal, weighing 0.30ct, is mounted in this simple band. Organic in styling, looking like the diamond grew right there on the ring, this piece is simple, elegant, and one of a kind. 

The diamond is untouched by human hand as far as faceting, polishing, and drilling are concerned. All we did was set it. 

The band is narrow, not tiny thin, but dainty. Appx 1.75mm on the very bottom, graduating to appx 3mm on top. The diamond setting itself is about 5mm across, and sits low to the finger so it won't catch on everything. 

Diamond is a heavily cleaved/included cognac-brown color, set in hand carved and hand cast sterling silver. Free sizing. 

SJC
name: Well, That's Rough...

description:
Our original rose wedding set features organic undulating lines of gold with tiny buds sprouting from the side. A central rose, elegantly set on the engagement band, holds a gemstone- in this case a natural pink sapphire weighing 3/4ct. The sapphire measures appx 5mm and has a lovely shade of rich rose pink. The stone is Indian mined and faceted, so there's a bit of asymmetry to the cutting. It's folded into the petals delicately but firmly- meant to wear strong for many years to come.

The wedding band curls around the central rose, pierced in areas so that the skin shows through. Another rosebud, offset, holds a tiny 0.04ct round diamond in the petals, and the band is decorated with tiny rosebuds just beginning to peek through the leaves.

Want it in white gold? Added diamonds on the sides? See Customizable form for information.
name: Pink Sapphire and diamond rose set

variations.backorder_notes: Please allow 3 - 6 weeks for this order to be created.

description:
A thick band of silver wraps in a ribbon around the finger, clutching a vivd green rough demantoid garent in trailing tendrils. Two round green tourmalines, hued similarly to the central stone, are tucked into the design, visible from the sides. Tiny droplets of leftover silver dot the design, and the ring is finished to a brilliant polish all over.

The central stone was purchased direct from the African miners, and treated only with a scrubbing. No polishing, cutting, or drilling was applied to this piece. The color is completely natural, and there are cleavage planes and inclusions visible inside the stone. It is set low to the finger so as not to catch and snag as much. It measures appx 10 x 12mm. The tourmalines are from Brazil, faceted normally, round in shape, and measuring 3 and 4mm respectively.
name: Mine the Raw Green

description:
Kunzite is one variant of spudomene, a delicately pink gemstone with a hardness of 6.5 and a sensitivity to UV. The stone has a gentle glimmer to it, not a very high refractive index, and can bleach out if left in the sunshine for long periods. Yet- it is a lovely stone, hues of pastel color showing from its depths.

This stone measures 12 x 16mm, cut into a deep oval with a keel that runs nearly the length of the stone. It is set up high in thick round prongs that arch away from the band. The stone weighs just over 10 carats.

The band is comprised of bits of garden vines arching and tangling within the thick rails of silver. Tiny repurposed diamonds, barely visible against the white metal, are set into ends of the vinework. Ten diamonds in all, total diamond weight appx 0.08ct. The band is 11m wide all around, 16mm on top.

Not sizable due to the design. The band design itself is available with other gemstones, with or without the diamonds. This ring fits snugly due to its extreme width.
name: Kunzite Garden

The somewhat kidney-shaped stone rests in a shredded bezel setting, open underneath in some spots to reveal a bit of light through the stone.

A ripple of molten silver beside the opal holds a single marquise diamond, measuring 2 x 4mm. This is a re-purposed stone, set deeply into the silver, and it weighs 1/10ct. The ring is 19mm at its widest point, and 7mm on the bottom of the shank. Price includes free sizing, select your size from the dropdown box.

The band is pierced and bent, rippled and open. Completely one of a kind.

description:

This ring is cast in 14k yellow gold, accented with a strip of 14k white gold and single, tiny diamond. 

Each Root ring is formed from piece of wax leftover from other design processes. The steps that we take to achieve the unique textures and lines are our trade secret. No two will ever be remotely alike- so collect your favorites!

description:
Cast in 14k champagne gold, with white gold accents, this Root Ring underwent a graft at some point in the creation process. Roots tremble up the side of the band, joining with a budding piece of gleaming gold on top, then make their simple way back down the other side of the band. 

Champagne gold is a mix of white and yellow gold, with a hint of rose. The overall effect is a lovely silky color that looks well against any skin tone. 

Our Root Rings are made individually, no two are ever remotely alike. To us, they embody the completely organic nature of this world that we occupy, and they are one of our favorite pieces to work on! If you would ever like an adventurous custom piece, let us know what metal, gemstone, and size you would like, and see what 'grows' for you... 

This ring is 15mm at its widest point. 14k champagne gold, completely one of a kind. These rings are very comfortable to wear, but fit a bit snug due to their extreme width. We recommend ordering a half size larger than you normally take.
name: Grafted. A Root Ring.

description:
Chrysocolla is a quartz-based gemstone that is found in copper mines in the Southwestern US as well as Russia. The oxidizing copper provides the intense blue and green hue. This stone darkens with age, taking on a more translucent property. Some jewelers sell a version of chrysocolla that is heavily veined and mottled, ours is clean and clear- this is referred to as 'gem silica' and is much longer-wearing and valuable than what is often seen. 

This stone is a squared oval, 12 x 8mm. The color is an intense cerulean blue with just partial opacity. Immediately beside the stone sits a large baguette diamond weighing appx 0.15ct. Down one side of the intricately worked band you will find another diamond baguette, this one weighs 0.05ct. Total diamond weight for the ring is 0.20ct. 

Part of our 'Underground' series, this ring was inspired by lengths of conduit running along the subway tunnels. Cast in 18k yellow gold, it is a heavy and substantial piece. 

Square in shape, which conforms naturally to the finger, this ring is incredibly comfortable. It is not sizable due to its unique detailing. 

14mm wide at the widest point, appx 12mm at the base.

Completely one of a kind.
name: Conduits and Chrysocolla

variations.backorder_notes: Please allow 3 - 6 weeks for this order to be created.

description:
The Underground rings are inspired by subway rails, rusting plumbing, and electrical conduits... the belly of the City. 
The rings roll and fold and travel in angles and repeating lines. Their finish is at once gritty and polished, scraped and hammered. Made to withstand heavy wear, they are square in shape and fit the finger like they were made for it. This is one of the most comfortable and unique rings you will ever wear, as long as you're bold enough to handle the sheer width and weight! 

This ring- the Green Underground- has as a centerpiece an elongated green tourmaline: pine green at one end deepening to a rich viridian at the other end. The crystal of tourmaline commonly contains inclusions, but this piece is relatively clean. The stone is 20 x 5mm, set into heavy silver end caps. 

Directly beside the tourmaline you will see a row of five princess cut green sapphires. These are natural colored stones, 2.5mm square, and total appx 3/4ct in sapphire weight. To the other side of the tourmaline is a small piece of black onyx, 12 x 3mm. 

On the bottom corner of the ring is a row of 3 baguette diamonds set end to end. They weigh appx 1/5ct and have been cast directly into the metal. The ring has a dripping cutout hole on one side, folds of silver forming the band, and a sandblasted/stone ground//wax scraped//melted/hammered/polished finish. 

This ring measures 1" at its widest point on top, and just under half an inch on the bottom. Cast in sterling silver, it is completely one of a kind and cannot be ordered in any variation. 

Sizing: this ring fits a 9.5 - 10 finger quite comfortably. Because of the unique texture, shape, and finish it can only be sized up by one size or down by two sizes. It was made for a middle or index finger but can be worn wherever you choose.
name: Green Underground

variations.backorder_notes: Please allow 3 - 6 weeks for this order to be created.

customizable_notes: Interested in gold? These bands in gold start at $1,100 without stones, going up in price from there.
description:
The bands photographed measure appx 8mm. They are sandblasted in the center and high polished on the outside edges. A melted texture was applied before casting, and 5 gemstones each band were set into the tidal waves. Bezel set low and secure, these stones won't be coming out anytime soon! The band is incredibly comfortable, slightly comfort fit inside, and durable for years of wear.

Price is for **one** band, if you need a set, please order twice, specifying size, width, and gems each time. Thank you.

You can order this band in any width from 4-12mm, any finger size from a 2.5 to a 25, and in any finish- as shown, full sandblast, full polish, blackened, blued, or antiqued. 

Choose your stones: a scattering of family birthstones, your own favorite gemstone, whatever. This price includes five (or less) 2mm round stones. If you want more, or a different shape or size stone, please let me know so I can quote the job and build a different listing for you.

The production entails a hand-torn, hand-formed wax model. Each ring starts from a fresh wax, there is no mold for this piece. I melt and bend and heat and flow the wax to form this pattern. Each ring is utterly unique, and it is rather difficult to exactly determine the final shape, but that is the beauty of an organically formed ring.

Handmade in our store in Northern Michigan.

The bands are hand cast from recycled sterling silver. We melt down old silverware, broken jewelry, etc... have it refined for impurities, and have the pure silver sent back to us. We then alloy that metal back down to sterling (which is 92.5% aG) and cast in our little foundry.

The emeralds photoed in this band are diamond-cut, which means they were cut with the facets and proportions of a diamond. They are sparkly, intense green, and vary in size around 2mm or less. You may order any stone you could want- alexandrite, sapphire, garnet... if the stones you choose come in at a lower price (for example, garnet is much cheaper than alexandrite) I will refund you the difference.

Interested in gold? These bands in gold start at $700 without stones, going up in price from there.

Exclusive to Wexford Jewelers.
name: Melted Band w/ Gemstones

description:
Our standard railed band is the basis for this piece. We heated the aquamarine and actually melted it into the wax, forming a stone seat that was perfectly fitted to the rough gem. Prongs hold the stone firmly in place, and two tiny baguette diamonds accent, also in prongs. 

The inside of the band is brushed silver, while the tops of the rails are polished bright. The band measures appx 7mm wide, the aqua measures appx 9 x 10mm and is completely unpolished, and the diamonds weigh a total of appx 0.06ct. 

The band itself is comfort fit, perfect for a man or woman. Makes an excellent thumb band, wedding band, or just an everyday-wearing kinda ring!

description:
Raw aquamarine- genuine aquamarine mined and set in jewelry without any faceting or polishing- is a cool blue earthy stone. Natural color, natural crystal formation, and a subtle glow are all aspects of this gem.

This somewhat matching pair was perfect for earrings, so we put them into a one-of-a-kind earring design- a wraparound bezel with divots and notches and beads.

Dangling from angular shepherd's hooks. Stones measure appx 6 x10mm, total length is appx 3/4". All of the silver is blackened with a matte chemical wash. The sulphur used for the blackening has been steamed off, so there is ano residue to affect your ears form the posts- simply an oxidized surface.

Cast in sterling silver, these earrings are completely unique.
name: Raw Aqua Earrings

description:
Ammolite is a form of fossilized opal-like mineral found primarily in Alberta, Canada. It is thought by some to be the rarest of all gemstones in the world. It is an organic stone, like pearls and amber, and there is much mysticism associated with it among the indigenous peoples of the area where it is found. Slivers of green, orange, and brown run through it, and the stone has incredible chatoyancy (shimmery properties) while still managing to be understated, somehow. 

 It is a *very* soft stone (Mohs hardness of appx 5), so if you purchase this or another please be careful with it. Many businesses sell triplets of this, which is a thin sliver of the stone encased in quartz for strength. We prefer the all natural route, as laminated stones can and will separate over time, while a regular one can be re-polished if necessary. 

This stone measures appx 20mm long and is bezel set with a flowing, undulating rim of gold. This is mounted on a wide band, tapering to about 6mm on the bottom. The band is edged in a raised rail, gently following the natural bend of the ring without bringing hardness or too much symmetry to the design.

Two 2.5mm round demantoid garnets are the accent stones on this piece, and they are set with bead prongs that repeat the shape beyond the actual setting. The underside of the stone has an open and hand-twisted gallery work that bubbled and simmers in design. The raised areas of the ring- rails and beadwork- are polished bright, while the lower recesses are sandblasted. Hand carved and hand set, totally one of a kind.
name: Ammolite and Green

description:
Charoite is a naturally purple opaque stone, which is rare in the gem world. It is found only in Siberia, and has strict export limitations, so it is not often found in large quantities. It can only be mined for 2-4 months of the year, as the ground is often frozen solid. The stone has a bit of natural chatoyancy, swirls of white and pink and even brown, and a hardness of 6. 

This ring features an 8 x 10mm oval charoite in a sterling silver band, rimmed by a beaded corona. The entire band is appx 13mm wide on top, 6 on bottom.

description:
A beautifully variegated natural Russian azurite is the centerpoint of this pendant. Measuring 29 x 18mm, and shaped like a dagger blade, this unique stone needed an equally unique setting. 

Every tiny bit of this pendant was handcarved- every little detail and wave and curl of silver cut out and built up and planned. 

The pendant bail holds an 8 x 6mm emerald cabochon, as well as four 0.03ct single cut antique diamonds. The bail is fixed to the pendant- not free-hanging- and is open on the very top to show the chain/neckwire/omega. 

The azurite is held in by a network of flowing, ebbing line of silver that rise from the neck to grip the stone. A rail runs the bottom length of the stone, standing up off the collarbone to keep the pendant level, and the lines of silver flow to this rail- growing from it as well as to it. 

The diamonds are set in an organic channel, interrupted by more flowing lines. simple prongs are used to hold the emerald in place, and the backside of the stone has lost no attention to detail. Swirls and reticulating curls of silver allow the blues and greens of the azurite to peep through, but provide a sturdy backing for the main gem. 

The entire pendant measures appx 1.5" x 1.5". It is shown hung from an 8mm omega collar (included in the price), but can be switched for a different necklace if need be. The collar fits an average neck. 

SJC
name: Roots of Life

Included is a sterling neckwire. Fits a standard neck as a choker.

description:
A raw multi-toned Kenyan sapphire is set in this ring, straddling two bands. The stone is roughly 9x6 mm and has a very uniformly pitted texture. The body color is yellow, with a second, brighter shade of yellow in the center. A bit of blue hue works its way in here and there. 

The band is also set with two 2mm round blue sapphires, prong set into circles that join the two rails. Ring is about 8mm wide at its widest point. Handmade, one of a kind, completely unique gemstone and setting technique. Sorry, but this ring cannot be sized due to design.

Sterling silver.

description:
Iron oxide quartz is a fascinating gem, with flecks of iron oxide trapped in quartz as the mineral was forming. 

This particular stone measures 25 x 17mm and rides nearly from knuckle to knuckle on most fingers. The band is concave, brushed with a glittering stone wheel texture, with a bit of high polish on top and bottom. On the bottom two corners rest two (2) approx 7 x 5mm rough garnets, bar set. The main stone is held in place with thick prongs, set low into a custom built contoured box.

SJC
name: Iron Oxide Knuckleduster

description:
Medusa quartz is so named for the tiny blobs of gilalite inside. The circular, flattish inclusions look like medusa jellyfish, and appear to be floating inside the clear quartz. It is a rare and  fascinating gemstone.

This curved-edge trapezoidal piece is prong set into a custom built necklace, topped by a second gemstone: apatite. Apatite is a fluorescent property gemstone, vaguely related to your own tooth enamel, but completely natural in color and crystal form.

The Medusa quartz measures appx 13 x 10mm, and the apatite measures 6mm. The pendant measures just over an inch in length.

The pendant comes on a delicate twisted neckwire, with just enough movement to lay nicely on the collarbone. The clasp is nearly hidden- thin and contoured to the necklace instead of a heavy lumpy ring in back. Artist signed.

SJC
name: Medusa Quartz Simplista Pendant

variations.backorder_notes: Please allow 3 - 6 weeks for this order to be created.

description:
Intense cerulean and hazy white ebb and flow together in this pendant. Named for an atoll in the Maldives, the colors and lines are reminiscent of a tropical reef seen from afar.

The main stone is a drusy quartz pear measuring 18 x 30mm, held in place by a delicate network of silver lines. The base of the pendant hangs freely from the top, which has echoing lines and holds a 6mm apatite. The entire design is one of a kind, cast in sterling silver. Comes with a 16" neckwire.

Drusy quartz is an aggregation of hundreds (if not thousands) of tiny quartz crystals covering an agate or other silicate stone base. Because of the multitude of crystals, drusy sparkles from every angle, looking like a frost-covered wonderland. Apatite is an unusual gemstone, distantly related to the enamel on your teeth. 

SJC
name: Addu Atoll

description:
A raw padparadsha  sapphire, measuring 4 x 10mm, rests against the finger, set in tangled vines of detritus. The band goes from destroyed to smooth as it wraps around the finger, by the time it comes up on the other side of the finger it is hard and angular. A single round diamond, 0.06ct, is bezel set opposite the sapphire for the final touch.

The heavy silver band should keep the open top stable for many years to come, as long as this ring isn't bent open and shut multiple times. Fits a 6 or 6.5 finger comfortably, not sizable due to the design.

Padparadshca sapphires are some of the most lovely and rare of the natural colors. The color play of orange-pink-red is phenomenal, and this raw stone is completely rough- no cutting polishing, or drilling! Design 2010  Sarah J. Christenson.

SJC
name: Raw Padparadscha, Open to Interpretation

description:
A rough sapphire- completely uncut, unpolished, and undrilled- was cast directly into this ring alongside a scattering of tiny round faceted sapphires. Prongs wander up the edges of the stone, holding it tightly into the design. The smaller sapphires are buried deep into the design of the band.

The central sapphire measures appx 7 x 8mm, and has characteristic Kenyan color zoning and a slightly recognizable hexagonal crystal pattern. There is a spot of intense blue in the very center of the stone, radiating out to a softer sky blue at the edges. I've pierced the setting beneath the stone for light transmission and easier cleanup.

The smaller gemstones measure 2mm each and number three in total. The ring is cast in silver, one of a kind (as are most of our rough stones) and not sizable due to the design. The band is 6mm wide at the bottom, appx 9mm at the widest point.

The ring is shaped slightly squarish for a comfortable fit. Beads and undulating lines accent the surface, high spots are polished, while there is a sandblasted finish in the lower recesses.
 SJC
name: Arbitrary Blue
