description:
A raw tourmaline crystal lies against the finger in this ring, completely uncut and unpolished. The crystal measures 8 x 14mm approx, with color zoning from a delicate pink to lovely mint green. Naturally occurring burrs and lines mark the surface of the gemstone, features that will slowly wear over time into a softened look.

The ring is detailed with melted texture, as well as with eight 2.5mm diamonds- completing each corner of the ring. The diamonds are- like many of ours- repurposed. These ones were pulled from a meltdown tennis bracelet and reused in several of our ring designs. For every stone that does not have to be cut or recut, there's a bit more energy to go around! This is one reason our raw gem line is our very favorite.

The band is appx 9mm on the very top, tapering down to 3mm at the bottom center. Square corners keep the piece upright on your hand, and the solid silver structure will wear well for years and years to come. One of a kind. Diamonds weigh appx 1/2ct total, tourmaline crystal weighs appx 6cts.

description:
The ancient oaks of the Celts were holy places. Gigantic trees and symbols of life, they reached up to the heavens and down to the very recesses of the earth. When invading peoples cut them down and burned the groves, the religion of the people faltered, but from the charred stumps grew the occasional bit of new life.

This ring boasts an absolutely lovely 10 x 4mm imperial topaz, two-tone gradient from peach to salmon, emerald cut, set in a half bezel. One baguette diamond, 0.10ct is the single accent stone, resting parallel to the topaz. 

The band- a 14k yellow gold hand carved root setting- measures 19mm at widest, 7.5mm at narrowest. Comfortable square fit, not sizable due to design.

description:
Charoite is a rare stone- mined for only a few months out of the year in the frozen Siberian wilderness, the stone also has strict export laws in effect by the Russian government, so it's a bit rare stateside. It is a lovely stone, lavender-purple with swirls and bits of chatoyancy and milky shimmers in its depths.

A 12 x 9mm half-moon charoite cabochon is bezel set here, open underneath and resting on a unique band. The band is about 10mm wide, wider in some spots and narrower in others, comfort fit and slightly squared to naturally fit the finger. There is a diamond texture in spots near the edge, several bezel set round diamonds, re-purposed from older jewelry, and the ring is signed by the artist.

description:
Bands of twisting blackened silver form this ring. Roses and leaves complete the wild bramble design.

A genuine natural pink sapphire, 3mm, has been cast directly into one of the roses, and a 4mm cultured pearl rests in the largest rose. The ring twists and curves around the finger, tiny handcarved leaves offset the swirls.

Completely handcarved, dimensional all around, and one of a kind.  Sizeable by one to two sizes either up or down, no charge for sizing. Choose the size you need from the dropdown box, please. 

Design  2010, Sarah J Christenson 

The blackening is a residue-free chemical wash and is only on the surface. Over time, as you wear the ring, the white silver will begin to show through, bringing the ring to a lovely antique patina. The blackening can be reapplied at any professional jeweler if you like. 

SJC

description:
Freeform curls, bounded on the outside by smooth rounded rails, open in spots and tightly coiled in other spots... this ring stands up off the finger by about 1/2", with open space beneath. Two 14k yellow gold bezels hold 3.5mm light blue zircon rounds, and the design completes itself around the bottom of the finger.

Zircon- not to be confused with the simulant zirconia, is a natural stone with a high refractive index, or a heckuva lotta sparkle. The blue is irradiated, but is a permanent treatment and leaves a lovely stone. It is the original birthstone for December babies :)

The rest of the ring is cast in reclaimed sterling silver, appx 9mm wide. Size 7.5, not sizable due to its unique shape, but I would be happy to build you a similar one in your own size and with different gemstones, if desired. It would, of course, be completely unique.

description:
Simply a rose set amongst twisting vines and leaves, this little ring is perfect in its feminine appeal. The round gemstone is folded into the petals of the central rose, set low for durability. A tiny rosebud offsets the central blossom. The detail goes all the way around the band, handcarved exclusively by Sarah J Christenson.

Available in nearly any gemstone that can be cut to a 2-3mm, as well as nearly any metal. All gemstones listed are genuine- no lab created or simulants. This is also available as a wedding set.

Cast in our foundry in Northern Michigan, using reclaimed metals. Most of these are on a special order basis, but can be cast for you at a moment's notice.

If you purchase one of these rings for an engagement/promise ring, a fitted wedding band, [shown here](http://wexfordjewelers.com/items/514-Rose-Garden-Wedding-Set?variation_id=904) is available for purchase at a later date. If acquired in silver, we highly recommend having the set soldered together afterwards to maintain strength.

description:
This massive tourmaline is full of interesting things to gaze at for hours. It begins with a deep, deep teal color saturation at one end of the stone, fading gently to pink at the other end. It is full of inclusions, natural cleavage planes, and the detritus of crystal formation. 

The stone is cut as an elongated cushion, and is set high up from the finger in a broken organic design- shards of various shapes twist and fight to form the band and prongs.

Because of the great size and weight of this ring, it is best worn on the middle or forefinger.

description:
A 28 x 12mm strawberry rutile quartz is bezel set in this pendant, with four 4mm round madiera citrines accenting the corners.

Rails of silver run along the bottom edge on each long side, joining the citrine settings. The bail is fixed solid to the pendant, a double line of silver that can fit nearly any chain or omega. The back of the pendant is artist signed SJC 2009, the piece is one of a kind, cast in recycled sterling silver. A chain is included, a heavy 20" anchor link. If you need a different size of chain, please select your desired length.

Entire pendant measures 59mm in length.

*strawberry rutile quartz is a somewhat rare version of rutile or rutilated quartz. A mineral causes the usually gold rutile crystal to be red-orange colored, and the rutile spikes run thinner and smaller in this color. The composite mineral is formed when rutile spikes are present while the quartz is forming, and the delicate rutile- not wearable as jewelry on its own, is trapped forever in strong quartz- a wonderful phenomena in the mineral world!
name: Artifact

description:

The ring is structured of two bands that divide, come up to grasp the stone, then travel back down into a solid shank. Etched into these bands are various bits of rootwork, tunnels and lines, and, lastly- the word 'STAY' in hand-cut letters with serifs.

The ring is squared slightly to the finger's natural shape. It is incredibly comfortable to wear, and the chrysoberyl is a tough stone. This ring sits low to the finger and should last for many years. It measures appx 9 x 8mm, and the band tapers from appx 11mm to 6mm.

description:
Chrysacolla is a natural wonder of a gemstone- the intense color comes from oxidizing copper, the stones are often found in abandoned copper mines out west, as well as in Russia. The gem-quality stone is a silicate, which means it is quartz based. The natural Cerulean blue will actually deepen over time, as you wear it and your body oils penetrate the crystal matrix of the stone. Its value also goes up over time, as the translucent material is increasingly rare, and this even color tone is even more so. 
This Isosceles triangle lent itself perfectly to a simple pendant. Accented only by a diamond bail, the stone is bezel set with thin gold, hung from a sturdy but fine gold box chain. 
Total diamond weight on bail: 0.05ct. 

14k yellow gold 
One of a kind item.
name: Chrysocolla Isosceles Pendant

variations.backorder_notes: Please allow 3 - 6 weeks for this order to be created.

description:
This ring twists, turns, and surprises with acute angles and contrasting colors. 

A very fine, gem silica Chrysocolla is the centerpiece of this ring, and is accented by a glowing triangular fire opal. A 0.05ct baguette diamond nestles into a crevice on the obverse side. 

Chrysocolla is a natural wonder of a gemstone- the intense color comes from oxidizing copper, the stones are often found in abandoned copper mines in the Southwestern US, as well as in Russia. The gem-quality stone is a silicte, which means it is quartz based. The natural Cerulean blue will actually deepen over time, as you wear it and your body oils penetrate the crystal matrix of the stone. 
Its value also goes up over time, as the translucent material is increasingly rare, and this even color tone is even more so. 

Comfortable band. Completely one of a kind design.
name: Angles Chrysocolla Ring w/ Fire Opal

description:
Glittering deep blue goldstone, cut in a rolltop trapezoidal shape, set in a bold design.

THIS IS A LIMITED EDITION PIECE. We will only make 24 of these rings with this stone and this design. Your ring will be numbered inside (ie; 3/24) and artist initialled. Because of the L.E. status, whatever size you order will be cast and finished separately, please allow a few weeks for this. The ring photoed is a size 4.5, so larger sizes will have more design showing on the side. Designed 2011  Julie A. Terwilliger

A wide clean sweep of silver forms one side of the ring, and near-parallel bands meet at the bas and form prongs on top of the stone. The stone is set low to the finger and this wide design is very comfortable, but it does fit about 1/2 size tighter, so order with enough room.

This stone measures 16mm long, appx 12mm at the wider end and 9mm at the narrower. The flecks of mica inside the stone make it glitter like a constellation in the nighttime sky. The ring itself measures nearly 18mm across on the top, tapering to 9mm on the bottom of the band.

This is one of the few manmade gems we carry, it was just too pretty to pass up!
name: Andromeda Limited Edition

description:
Pyxis is the Mariner's Compass constellation, barely visible in the winter sky.

This ring holds a single .38ct 4mm rough brown diamond in a star-like box, angled bright polished prongs gripping the diamond in for all time. The design was taken from a ring made in the 1950s, and we thought the clean mid-century modern lines contrast perfectly with the rough crystal structure of this diamond.

This ring has an elegant design- the sides rise gently up from the band to form the stone setting, and triangular openings flank each side, giving the whole piece an airy feel. 

Measurements: the ring is just shy of 2mm wide in most areas, and about 1/4" wide on the very top.
name: Pyxis: Rough Diamond

description:

The setting is a simple narrow band, appx 3mm on top of the ring tapering to 2mm on the bottom. Melted, beaded prongs rise up from the band, forming a structure around the diamond crystal and trapping it in. Bright polished beading on the band completes the celestial look. SJC

description:
This Melted & Pierced band contains a single emerald- square cut, A grade, and the color of Kentucky bluegrass. Beside it are two antique step-cut square diamonds, pulled from an older diamond watch and reused here for more modern jewelry.

The emerald is set very low to the finger in prongs that rise from the design, and the diamonds are tucked neatly in, lower and also prong-set. The emerald measures 4.25mm and has cut  corners in the older Brazilian style of faceting. The stone has very visible inclusions and color zoning , thus the price. The diamonds weigh appx 0.04ct tdw. 

The band design consists of a varying width, rolled edge, cut with slashes and piercings. The finger is visible through the cuts when wearing, and the rolled edge makes for a rounded inside and is incredibly comfortable. This is a stock ring, so can be re-made with many different metals and gem combinations.

This listing is for a single ring as shown in the top photos, but is also available as a wedding set. [Matching band](http://wexfordjewelers.com/items/1179-Pierced-Melted-Band-Medium-Width) here.
name: Melted Emerald & Diamond Band

description:
Rough Kenya sapphire, lovely sky blue with just a hint of violet. This stone measures appx 9 x 7mm, and has the crystal formations visible all over the surface- ribbing and smaller crystal nodules, bits of varying color, and worn spots from being in the ground.

The band is one of our Melted pieces, formed by tearing and melting the wax to shape the ring, then building the stone setting. The design splits partway up the band and then meets again near the sapphire. The finish is sandblasted and polished. Prongs raise up from the ring and grip the sapphire firmly in place. Measuring 11m on the top, at the widest point, this ring tapers down to 5mm on the bottom of the band.

One of a kind. SJC.
name: My Own Piece of the African Sky

description:
This was the wedding ring worn by my Bisnonna (great-grandmother) Silvia Mascarin. We pulled a mold off it to preserve the lovely design for posterity.

Are we a little bit biased because we love to use it often? Maybe, but who cares? It's pretty enough to sway opinion.

Mathematically perfect sides forms Art Deco petals of a sort, holding the central stone in place, as well as being studded with a diamond each. This is the wedding set version of [this ring](http://wexfordjewelers.com/items/491-Bisnonna-s-Ring-?variation_id=556), although that ring can only be worn by itself, so if you ever intend to use this as a wedding set, this listing is the one to buy!

This ring is notched beneath for the band to fit up inside. The wedding band measures appx 2mm wide and has similar detailing on the sides- the small crease going up the band. 

The top round part of the design measures 10mm around, and the bands each begin at 2mm and widen just a bit as they go around the finger. Total band width (both bands together) at the bottom is just under 5mm.
name: Bisnonna Wedding Set
